meanings.definition: Promoting or relating to unity among different Christian churches.
meanings.sent1: The ecumenic gathering brought together members of various Christian denominations.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenic movement aims to foster cooperation and understanding between different Christian groups.
meanings.sent3: At the ecumenic picnic, everyone brought a dish representing their church's traditions.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an ecumenic beacon, uniting people from different faiths.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenic choir sang hymns in harmony, symbolizing unity among Christians.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the whole inhabited world; universal.
meanings.sent1: The ecumenic map displayed all continents and oceans in one view.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenic perspective considers the interconnectedness of all cultures across the globe.
meanings.sent3: His dream was to travel the ecumenic lands and experience diverse cultures.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting captured the ecumenic beauty of nature on a single canvas.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenic concept of peace transcends borders and unites humanity in harmony.
